title: The Quotient Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: The square root of the quotient $$\frac{a}{b}$$ is equal to the quotient of the square roots of a and b, where b≠0: $$\sqrt{\frac{a}{b}}=\frac{\sqrt{a}}{\sqrt{b}}$$

title: The Quotient Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\sqrt{\frac{5}{36}}=\frac{\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{36}}$$

title: Principal Square Root
text: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand: $$\sqrt{a}$$.

title: Principal Square Root
text: What number multiplied by itself equals 36?
